titlepage.subtitle: Finding Aid
titlepage.sponsor: Encoding funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: History of Northampton and its environs. Contains correspondence, manuscripts, photographs, and publications.

scopecontent.p: The collection was collected by the Smith College Archives over an extended period and included in the subject files are correspondence, manuscripts, photographs, programs and other primary source materials. The collection is arranged in alphabetical order by subject. The collection is not complete, and materials are added to it on a regular basis. For in-depth research pertaining to Northampton and other local history, researchers should contact Historic Northampton, Inc. and the Forbes Library, as they have a greater depth of local history collections.
The College Archives also has books relating to Northampton and surrounding towns.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Northampton and Local History Collection, Box #, Smith College Archives.

acqinfo.p: The Northampton and Local History Collection Records were donated over a period of time to the Smith College Archives from a variety of sources.

bibliography.head: Bibliography
bibliography.p: Books about Northampton in the Smith College Archives

list.item: Bliss, Arthur Ames. Theodore Bliss, Publisher and Bookseller: A Study of Character and Life in the Middle Period of the XIX Century. Northampton Historical Society, 1914
Brown, E. Francis. Joseph Hawley: Colonial Radical. New York: Columbia University Press, 1903
Clarke, Rev. Solomon. Antiquities, Historicals and Graduates of Northampton. Northampton: Gazette Printing, 1882
Early Northampton. (pub. by the Betty Allen Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution) Springfield: F.A. Bassette Co. 1914
Edwards, William H. Timothy and Rhoda Ogden Edwards of Stockbridge Mass, and their descendants; a genealogy. Cincinatti: The Robert Clarke Co. 1903
Gere, Henry S. Reminiscences of Old Northampton: sketches of the town as it appeared from 1840-1850. [Northampton], 1902
Hawthorne, Hildegarde. Rambles in Old College Towns. New York: Dodd, Mead and Co. 1917
Historical Register and General Directory of Northampton. Northampton: Gazette Printing Co. 1875-76
Johnson, Clifton. Historic Hampshire in the Connecticut Valley; happenings in a charming old New England county from the time of the dinosaurs down to about 1900. Springfield: Milton Bradley, 1932
Knab, Frederick. 1902-1903: Northampton of Today, depicted by pen and camera. Northampton: Picturesque Publishing Company, 1902
The Meadow City's Quarter Millennial Book, a Memorial of the Celebration of the two-hundred and fiftieth anniversary of the Settlement of the town of Northampton, Massachusetts. June 5-7, 1904
The Northampton Book: Chapters from three hundred years in the life of a New England Town, 1654-1954. (pub. by the tercentenary committee) Brattleboro: Alan S. Browne, Inc. 1954
Northampton, The Meadow City. Northampton: Kneeland and Bryant, 1894
Northampton and the Northampton Institute for Savings, 1842-1942. Northampton: Metcalf Printing and Publishing Co. Inc. 1942
Trumble, James Russell. History of Northampton, Mass. from its settlement in 1654. Northampton: Press of Gazette Printing, 1902
Well, Daniel White and Ruben Field Wells. A History of Hatfield, Mass. 1660-1910. Springfield: F.C.H. Gibbons, 1910.
